newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Steamers hits new high on telecoms deal.
newsitem.headline: Steamers hits new high on telecoms deal.

text.p: Steamers Maritime Ltd, a unit of Keppel Corp, hit a new high of Singapore $1.48 in early trading on Wednesday.
After about 20 minutes of trading, the stock was changing hands at S$1.47, up three cents over its previous close on volume of 109,000 units.

Dealers said the stock has been rising since late last week after several stockbroking houses have issued buys on the company on the back of it being a partner in a consortium that is going to operate Singapore's second mobile phone system.
"It is a straightforward story. Steamers is going to a telecom play," said a dealer with a local firm.
Steamers' traditional business is shipping and logistics.
